I tried putting the oil in my hair once after the shower and when my hair actually dried, it looked a little greasy. Either it is a little too heavy to put in my hair or I put too much in. Either way, it did make my hair soft and it seemed to lock in lots of moisture. This product really does wonders for dry skin/hair.

I was a little hesitant because I thought it'd be way too oily, but it absorbed very nicely and left my skin feeling extremely soft. Would definitely recommend!

  298. I love argan oil to start with. After years of battling cystic acne and skin that was blotchy, and oily, and sensitive, and just not appreciative of all the money I spent on it ... I discovered argan oil. I was skeptical to say the least but I hung in there. After six months or so I started to see improvement: the 'mothers' (cysts under the skin of my chin which gave me a lovely 'wicked witch of the west' profile) became smaller and vanished, leaving blueish purple scars behind. My skin texture improved: from bumpy to smooth like a baby's behind (sans diaper rash, of course). My face started to look dewy not sweaty or oily (still using a primer though) and I became hopeful. It is a year later and I am noticing that the mothers scars are fading and I use less and less concealer on my chin. I really appreciate the dispenser on this bottle: it gives me a consistent amount of argan oil to massage into my still a bit damp skin so I never use too much (which can be .. well, too much). One pump for my face, another for my neck and still another for my décolleté. Done. Woot!

  300. Good for skin/face, not so much for hair. On hair, even when used sparingly, it leaves it feeling kind of greasy. I dig that it's all natural, but for hair I will go with the argan oil that contains some silicone. The silicone additive makes the argan oil work better as a hair care product, in both the application and the results. It's not as if you're gonna be drinking the stuff, so some added silicone is not any issue, and shouldn't be if what you're looking for is a product that works to help soften and control thick, dry, unruly hair. Plus, this stuff doesn't smell nearly as good as the other Moroccan Oil hair treatments. This stuff is good out of the shower on damp skin - other than that, not impressed. if you require 100% oil, then I suppose this is ok. But if you also want results from an argan oil hair treatment, then look elsewhere.

  308. I bought this product to keep down the frizzes with my hair. I was surprised to read all of the review of people who use it on their skin and I didn't really think I'd try that. Well, needless to say, I gave it a whirl and I LOVE this stuff on my hair AND my skin. For my hair, I was really amazed at how great my naturally wavy/curly hair looked without anything else in in and air dried. My hair has always just been straggly and frizzy unless I either defused and scrunched it or straightened it; air drying my hair was never an option. Now, I feel confident walking out the door with a head of wet hair and arriving at work in my professional position with my hair looking fantastic as it dries. This is SUCH a time saver. Of course I still defuse it or straighten it when I feel like it and the Argan Oil really does all that it claims to do. A note of caution, play with the amount to see what works best for you. My hair is just below my collar bone and neither thin nor thick, 2 pumps is about right for me. If I put more than that in then my hair looks wet even when it dries and can look greasy. 2 pumps and my hair just looks like beautiful healthy hair. I've also been using this on my son's hair since the product he was using always made my face break out when he'd cuddle, this is great because it's good for your skin so if his product is up against my face I don't break out. I also add a pump or two to my normal hair care products when I use them, but I don't really need to use anything else. Now, for my skin. I have combo skin with an oily T zone and this stuff didn't make me break out or get oily. Again, you have to play with it to get the right amount. I was using 3 pumps morning and night but that was too much. One to two pumps is perfect. I like to rub it in gently, but for more time than my normal stuff so that the oils warm up and really get absorbed. I also add this to my normal day and night lotions when I use them. Make sure your face is dry before you use it because oil and water don't mix. I've found that if my face is still wet when I put it on then it does make me break out but if I wait a minute or two after towel drying my face, I know my skin will look glorious. I'm sure there are a lot of other uses but my face and hair are all I need it for. I'm sure you'll like it. I actually see people with frizzy hair when I'm out and about and wish I could just go up to them and suggest this stuff. I've been SO tempted because I know they'll love it and it would really help their hair look healthy and beautiful rather than dry and fuzzy. My hair was pretty healthy to start with. I bought it strictly for the fly-aways I was getting when I straightened it after a new hair cut and just fell in love from there.y before you use it because oil and water don't mix.   513. I first heard of Argan Oil after noticing several friends on Instagram (from different parts of the world) raving endlessly about it, and having a soft spot for all things au naturel, I decided to give this a try.<br /><br />As a point of reference, I have normal to dry skin and previously, my skin-care routine would include the not-so-budget-friendly Repairwear Laser Focus by Clinique, its Dramatically Different Moisturizing lotion, Moisture Surge, Pore Refining Solution, All About Eyes (de-puffing) and Aveeno's range of face-cleansing products. Having received my first bottle of Argan Oil, I decided to stop the Clinique products and used only (one drop of) the Argan before bedtime and pre-makeup routine. In the morning, I wake up with a bright, soft, supple face, and application before makeup gives me the dewey look - not the oily kind, just nice and fresh-looking (and I'd like to reiterate again that I only use one drop from the pump for the entire face - not sure what happens if you put more, maybe, maybe it will make you look oily). My point is, it has the same exact effects as the more costly Clinique products I've been using, in fact, only better, because it is organic, and not synthetically-made, not to mention that the Clinique products did not give me that dewey, healthy glow. I especially appreciate the convenience of having to use only one product for both night cream and daily moisturizer than the list of products I mentioned above. It's really that good that even my non-metrosexual (read: typical guy, with non-elaborate skin-care routine) husband has joined in the bandwagon and noticing significant difference with his skin.<br /><br />As a minor comment for improvement, it would be nice if Pura d'or can revise the information pamphlet that comes with the packaging for a more professional and convincing look and feel because the written description (in English) that came in mine was hanging, &#34;Pura d'or argan oil aids in building firmer skin, while restor- &#34; - well, some people do read the fine print and benefit from the little details provided :)<br /><br />Otherwise, all else is really neat about this product. It is also available in the 2oz/100ml option which makes it easier to bring along as a carry-on luggage during air travel. Definitely will repurchase and highly recommend to those who are seeking natural alternatives and support businesses that are mindful to mother Earth i.e. the company uses unbleached recycled paper for the pamphlets and printing ink used was produced from a sustainable process, the fabric pouched included in the packaging made from natural fibers is reusable, disposable, biodegradable etc., just perfect for the environmentally conscientious.estor- &#34; - well, some people do read the fine print and benefit from the little details provided :)<br /><br />Otherwise, all else is really neat about this product.   632. Being a \\"southern girl\\" transplanted to New England almost 8 years ago, I feel a like like a fish out of water due to the lack of humidity. The cold weather months wreak havoc on my skin. The fact that it was pure, organic, and cold pressed sealed the deal and I ordered the 1 oz bottle to give it a try.<br /><br />I've used it now twice daily for almost two months and can honestly say it has completely saved my skin. After the first couple of days of use I noticed most of the tightness, especially around my eyes, was gone. Within about a week my skin was no longer sensitive. About a week ago I glanced at myself in the mirror and noticed my skin actually had some glow to it again which I have not noticed in almost 8 years.<br /><br />It absorbs wonderfully into the skin, and does not leave a greasy feeling. I put in directly on my face both in the morning and evening and work it in before applying my normal moisturizer. I've found that leaving your face slightly damp after washing it helps the oil spread around a little more easily as you try to work it in, and absorbs a little more quickly.<br /><br />I add about 4-6 drops (the 1 oz. bottle has a dropper) to my body lotion before I put it on. I also apply 2-3 drops to my hand and work it into my damp hair before styling it. Soft glowing skin and soft shiny hair thanks to the Pura D'or Argan Oil! I will never be without it again, and plan on purchasing the 4 oz. bottle when my 1 oz. bottle runs out.

  669. Good stuff, I think. It did not turn my skin green.
  670. Argan Oil is a plant oil produced from the kernels of the argan tree that is endemic to Morocco. It is used for nutritive and cosmetic properties. Unroasted argan oil is traditionally used as a treatment for skin diseases and as a cosmetic oil for skin and hair.<br /><br />&#34;In cosmetics, argan oil is advocated as moisturizing oil, against juvenile acne and flaking of the skin as well as for nourishing the hair. This oil has also medicinal uses against rheumatism and the healing of burns. Externally, the oil is used to maintain & fortify healthy hair and in the treatment of wrinkled or scaly dry skin.&#34;<br /><br />Argan oil has become increasingly popular for cosmetic use. The number of personal-care items on the US market with this all natural product as an ingredient has increased significantly from 2007 to 2011. It is sometimes mixed with pomegranate seed oil due to its anti-oxidizing benefits, with vendors promoting this blend as an all-in-one serum both for skin and hair. I do not recommend using anything except 100% argan oil, as in the Pura'd'or product. Argan oil is sold without additives as a natural skincare and hair care product.<br /><br />Since Argan oil is full of vitamins and antioxidants. It is commonly used in hair shampoos and conditioners to repair damage caused by coloring and straightening treatments, hair care tools, and even the sun. Argan oil contains tocopherols (vitamin E), phenols, carotenes, squalene, and fatty acids. The main natural phenols in argan oil are caffeic acid, oleuropein, vanillic acid, tyrosol, catechol, resorcinol. After blow drying my hair, I put just a tiny drop of the oil on the palm of my hand and rub my hands together, then smooth through my hair. If you use more oil, your hair will become greasy. Just a drop will make your hair shines...it gives it luster.<br /><br />The increasing popularity of argan oil has prompted the Moroccan government to plan for increased production, with their aim being to increase annual production from approximately 2,500 to 4,000 tonnes by 2020.<br /><br />I also use Pura D'or on my face - again, a small drop goes a long way. It can also be used for any rough patches of skin, i.e., elbows, callused feet, etc. I have researched other brands of Argan Oil and Pura D'or is the best. It comes in a brown bottle so as not to allow the sun destroy it's potency.<br /><br />I cal this &#34;Pure Gold in a Bottle&#34;, as do some of my friends who now use it based on my recommendation.<br />JANAnual production from approximately 2,500 to 4,000 tonnes by 2020.<br /><br />I also use Pura D'or on my face - again, a small drop goes a long way. It can also be used for any rough patches of skin, i.e., elbows, callused feet, etc. I have researched other brands of Argan Oil and Pura D'or is the best. It comes in a brown bottle so as not to allow the sun destroy it's potency.<br /><br />I cal this &#34;Pure Gold in a Bottle&#34;, as do some of my friends who now use it based on my recommendation.<br />JANA

  685. I'm a huge believer in the power of organic oils. I enjoy facial oil cleansing & have collected a wide variety of oils in my research for natural cleansing & moisturizing alternatives.<br /><br />Let me begin with the packaging. These guys care about the environment & it's apparent by the way everything was packaged. The insert was printed on recycled paper, the oil came with a cute little pouch made of natural fibers. I liked that little extra touch because I tend to get my bottles a little greasy & the little bag solved that problem. I massage 2 pumps worth of oil onto my face for about a minute or until it absorbs, which it does unbelievably well and quite quickly.<br /><br />This is the only oil that doesn't make me feel greasy or as if it's just sitting on top of my skin and I no longer leave oil stains on my pillow cases because it practically disappears, leaving behind a supple and silky feeling. Those pink cheeks went away soon after I moved out on my own & began feeding myself. ' Seems like this oil really helps with blood circulation, hence the pinkish hue to my cheeks & the vibrant, healthy glow to my skin. I wish I would have used this sooner!<br /><br />I love this oil so much I put it in my body lotion, shampoo, conditioner, my home-made oil lotion bars and of course, I clean my face with it (by rubbing 3 pumps worth of it for about two minutes, then wiping it off with either a warm, wet towel or a dry one, depending on how lazy I feel that day or night).<br /><br />I love, love, LOVE this! Do yourself a favor & try it yourself. It's wonderful stuff. This oil is definitely a must-have for any beauty regimen. It leaves my hair a lot more manageable and I have less breakage. I'm so happy with my purchase. I will definitely purchase again!

My only real complaint is that it doesn't work very well as a daytime moisturizer because of the way it can repel mascara and other eye makeup (the makeup falls off my eyes and under my eyes - not pretty.) I also use a couple drops on my hair when wet and it makes my hair luxurious without being at all greasy - which was a surprise because any other oil i've tried has left a greasy after effect - ew.) There is really no smell, which is fine. I plan to add a high-quality, non-toxic vitamin C serum to my nightly regimen but haven't found the right one. This also lasts a really long time and is a wonderful value. I don't write a bunch of reviews on products, but I thought this was worthwhile.

It is a must by; organic based items are the best way to go and most beauty supply stores will not have.
  789. This is a great product because it can be used as a moisturizer, hair treatment, massage oil, and more. I really like having one product that I can use for all those things. As a moisturizer for dry skin it feels great because it's not too oily. It also does a great job of smoothing out dry, frizzy hair and treating split ends.<br /><br />The price is pretty good considering the size you get (4 oz.), and its versatility also makes it a really good buy.   821. Based on the positive reviews, I decided to purchase this brand of argan oil to replace a more expensive brand I had been using. Upon using Pura D'or for the first time, I noticed a strong antiseptic odor, which made me suspicious that the product was NOT 100% pure argan oil. I contacted the company and the person with whom I spoke confirmed that they use tea trea oil and other \\"things\\" to \\"sanitize\\" batches. I pointed out that if they are introducing tea tree oil or other items into the argan oil, it is no longer 100% pure argan oil. The individual with whom I spoke assured me that the product is 100% argan oil, but there is no way that a product which has such a strong medicinal, antiseptic smell is 100% argan oil. I have used 100% pure deordorized organic argan oil in the past and the consistency was never as watery as Pura D'or's product and there was never a medicinal, antiseptic odor. Pura D'or is clearly misrepresenting the quality of its product. I will be going back to my previous brand of 100% pure argan oil. It may be more expensive than Pura D'or, but at least I can rest assured that it is 100% pure argan oil.

  823. The argan oil itself is perfect! Great quality and consistency, and really makes my skin look and feel great. My only complaint, and the reason for 4 and not 5 stars, is the spray nozzle for dispensing. Perhaps I read the description incorrectly, but I thought the oil would be dispensed via a pump, similar to the pump toppers on lotion, and not by a spray top. I would have MUCH preferred a dropper, which is what most argan oil companies use, but I was willing to settle for a pump top. This spray top is really very annoying and I find myself removing the top to pour the oil into my hand, which I don't think is the most sanitary way (even with clean hands) to dispense and keep oil, since inevitably, some of the oil that gets on my hands winds up back in the bottle. Both a dropper top and a pump top would prevent this.

  874. I spent until my mid 20s fighting with my skin: dryness, flaking, eczema on my arms, acne, and facial redness (especially around my nose). I had been researching the idea of non-chemical skin care and Organic Pura d'or Argan Oil had been highly recommended for all skin and hair types. I was leery at first about putting oil on my fair skin because I didn't want to look like an oily mess but my reaction was the exact opposite. Since using this product the past 6 months all of my skin issues have cleared. I wash my face nightly using this and every morning I wake up with my skin glowing and feeling refreshed. Since going non-chemical with all of my beauty and body care products I have been free of hard and dry patches of skin on my arms and my hair looks healthier than ever. The bonus about this product is that the initial cost might seem steep but it lasts forever so I am saving money by not buying all of the corporate chemical products that are soaking toxins into my skin. Make sure you buy USDA Certified Organic 100% Argan Oil in a dark brown bottle. There are many knock offs and you want to make sure your skin is getting the full benefits. Pura d'or is the way to go; I will continue buying this product and recommending it to others.

  1009. After years of using a particular brand of skin products recommended by my dermatologist, I found myself looking for a natural alternative. The products she recommended sometimes stung my face when I first put them on, and in very dry climates, seemed to make my face feel dryer.<br /><br />Argan oil was recommended to me by my acupuncturist so I thought I'd give it a try. It's great on the face for overnight. It's gentle on my skin and acts as a great moisturizer. In the morning, my skin is soft. I never feel like there are chemicals riding roughshod on my skin because it's 100% natural.<br /><br />It's a little oily to use as a daytime treatment. However, during winter months or when visiting Arizona, I will sometimes use it during the day because I'm desperate for something to put on my face that will work. I try to limit how much I put on and am careful to work it into the skin so it doesn't feel oily on the surface. It definitely moisturizes my skin - no feeling of dryness. I also found that when I use it for dry lips, I don't have to keep reapplying it like I do chapstick. It definitely works.<br /><br />One thing that could use improving is the packaging. It would be great to have it in a nonbreakable bottle with a longer pump spout. When getting out the oil, both my hands tend to get oily and then the bottle gets slippery. It would be safer and easier if it were packaged differently.

The Pura d'Or did not work well on my long hair at all. It made it feel heavy and greasy which surprised me. I haven't tried it again. If you want to try using it on your hair, I suggest a teeny, tiny spray and only rubbing on the very, very dry ends of hair.<br /><br />In short, prepare to be blown away by this product. I spray a few drops of this on my palms and apply it to my hair when it is damp and then comb through my hair with a wide-tooth horn comb. The argan oil gives my hair a natural shine and smoothness which looks and feels very healthy. I had been using gels and pomades to keep my thick hair under control and make it less poofy, but this product is much healthier for someone wanting long, healthy hair. I have used coconut and olive oils in the past, and although they are also great for hair health, they left my hair feeling very greasy and gave it almost a wet appearance. My hair is only around nose length right now, so only 2-3 drops of this are needed; a little bit goes a long way! I may be imagining it but my hair also seems to be growing faster since using this product, which isn't a bad side effect for someone growing their hair out! I have also had great results using this product on some dry skin areas. I am Caucasian and my skin tans very easily in the summer time, and applying a tiny amount of this oil to my face, hands, and arms leaves them looking and feeling very healthy and maintains the bronze tan. This product is USDA Organic and contains high amounts of Vitamin E and other vitamins very beneficial for hair and skin health, and I would recommend it to anyone!

  1142. Lately I decided to make a big change in my face-care routine and go 100% natural. No chemicals at all! Unfortunately this meant making my own creams and lotions. A bit of a roller-coaster ride later, I finally heard about Argan Oil. By the time I read about Argan Oil, I knew it was perfect for me—zero comedogenic and excellent anti-aging properties! When I tried it I could tell immediately how good it was. It is now one of the chief elements in my oil cleansing routine. I use a mix of Hemp Seed Oil with a few drops of Argan Oil at night to cleanse with, and in the morning, all I do is rinse off my face with warm water and apply a few drops of Argan Oil or Rosehip Seed Oil. If during the day my face seems dry, I spritz it with a little rose water then apply as much Argan Oil as I feel is needed—without worrying about clogged pores! My skin is much clearer and brighter since using this oil. It has become essential to my skin health. Also—it is great for curly hair. After washing my hair, I run a drop of Argan Oil into my still wet hair, squish it in thoroughly, then squeeze my hair dry with a soft cloth (make sure it's not a terry-cloth towel since these ruin curls), style with a large toothed comb, then let it air dry. Voila, curls—without frizz and without oily film too. Argan Oil for me is really a terrific, must have skin care product.

Shiny, I have my waves back (it had flattened out), and softer than it was even before the shampoo nightmare. I think this is the wisest purchase I have ever made. Also, it's getting rid of a worry wrinkle between my brows and it's doing it fast! 2 days and massive improvement. Dark circles...working on that, too! You can use this on your hair, skin and nails for a smoother surface and softer cuticles!!! Their website has even more uses!: https://www.purador.com/pure-and-organic-argan-oil

I just use it on damp hair, a few drops on my palm, or on dry hair, a few drops mixed with a bit of tap water and just rub it on. Right now, my hair doesn't have that fake moistness, where you know that the oil is just sitting on top but underneath your hair is still crunchy. I can actually feel that the actual strands are not parched. As I rub my twists in between my fingers, I can feel that my hair feels silky and elastic. Yes that's the word, elastic. It's not dry at all, nor does my hair feel greasy in the least bit. If I got these results in just a few days, I can only imagine what kind of health my hair would be in a month or two from now.   1367. This argan oil does not have any smell at all! Means its deodorised. Sure its cold pressed, then it undergoes a process to take the smell away, its call deodorisation. And deodorisation is usually done with heat!. I have been using argan oil for years and decided to try this due to the reviews. I have used really good argan oil and for me, the raw and pure extra virgin smells slighty nutty, after all, argan oil is from argan nuts. I am not talking about the eatable argan oil, the eatable one is from roasted argan nuts, the smell is very strong and this is not for cosmetic use. I think for the cosmetic benefits, I prefer it to be undeodorised, to be pure and natural. Sure, a lot of argan oils on the market says 100 per cent argan oil, meaning its only argan oil, and organic, meaning under certain conditions it has been grown or harvested, but then, what process did it go through in the factory after that? Eatable argan oils are also 100 percent argan oils and certified organic, but its not good for your face as it has been roasted, stripping it of the healing properties. If you are using this for your hair, then, its fine. For face, me personally, I prefer not deodorised. Deodorisation is a process to take the nutty smell away so that the end result it smells of nothing. This process strips of not only the smell but some of the healing, restorative property. I love argan oil, as I said, have been using argan oil for years already. But most of my argan oils were purchased in Europe, in Germany and France. This is the first one I have purchased here from the States. Will be trying other brands.
  1368. Received a couple days ago and so far noticed it moisturizes hair, face, and nails really well. Wish I would have found out about it earlier.

I have used much more expensive facial products than this that give the same results or worse results. It is clear (some negative reviews comment on that it should be brown), and has no scent even though it comes from a nut. It's in the way it's processed. I'm sure I will be re-ordering.

  1616. I've waited 2 1/2 months to see the result before posting a review because I'd like to see for myself whether this product lives-up to a 5-star review or whether the product is a mere marketing hype. I have a dry skin and there's one area of my face that constantly grows acne either every week or every other week, it could be one or two of them appearing but having to endure a zit every month is nightmare and a source of embarrassment. Because of these acne marks that have developed for more than a decade, it left a scar on a particular area of my face and it also left a bit of a scar on my confidence. The quest to find the best solution came when one of my friends asked if I had a plastic surgery on this particular area of my face because of the deep and multiple acne scars it had left behind. That's it, I need to find a solution! I changed my diet to eating more fresh organic fruits and vegetables, enrolled myself into fitness class and bought 2 bottles of Pura d'or thinking perhaps, one bottle isn't enough! In a few days, after applying 2 drops, 3 x a day, the acne subsided and my skin felt relaxed. Yay, I am finally free of acne! This Argan Oil, in my experience, works on acne-prone skin, however, if I apply it to other normal parts of my face, it gives a little bit of a scaly appearance. So I use a different moisturiser for my normal skin type. I bought this for my acne problem, and for this reason alone, I'll give it a 5-star. It works well on my hair too, but coconut oil, in my opinion, is better as hair and facial moisturiser. I'll highly recommend this to anyone with acne-prone skin. It stops the acne from growing and erases any scars left on your skin. It doesn't happen overnight but at 2 1/2 months, 3 x a day, my scars have improved between 70-80%. I will definitely buy again. Thanks Pura d'or!

  1641. This is the real deal. There are lots of products that contain a small amount of argan oil, but Pura d'or is 100% argan oil. I recieved the oil a week ago, but here is what I've learned. I have dry hair from coloring it every 6 to 8 weeks. For my hair, I massage a few drops of argan oil into my hair before I shampoo (I let it stay in for just a few minutes). After I wash my hair, it is silky smooth and much easier to style. I tried to put a drop in my hair after I used the blow dryer, but it seemed too heavy for my hair. As for my face, I suffer from acne and wrinkles around the eyes. As odd as it sounds, I massage 2 drops of argan oil into my face each morning for about 30 seconds. The acne on my face is healing and -- the best -- wrinkles are starting to be less noticable. I wondered why this worked and did a little research. Here's what I found out. Argan oil is natural anti-inflammatory, so the nasty pimples look less red and swollen (yes...that includes those deep cyst-acne!) and it promotes good cell growth. As for the wrinkles, argan oil is full of vitamin E. My only warning...use a small amount of the oil. You might be tempted to think the more the better, but with argan oil, little goes a L-O-N-G way. You might have to use a little trial and error to find the right amount to use for your skin and hair. I'm starting to use the oil as a body moisturizer, but haven't used it long enough to tell you how well it works.

  1795. Ever since about two months before I came home from Iraq about 7 years ago I started having patches of psoriasis on my hands, arms, and legs. I’ve pretty much always had dry skin, but never before had I experienced an actual skin condition such as psoriasis. A couple years later, an Army doctor explained to me that while I most likely had a genetic predisposition toward psoriasis, the actual outbreaks were probably stimulated by some encounter with an allergen.<br /><br />For the last several years I have used every imaginable hand lotion, cortisone ointment, and pills to try to tame my psoriasis. While stationed in Korea, the condition of my hands become so bad that I wore bandaids non-stop because my skin was always cracking and often would start bleeding. The last couple years have been more moderate, but most nights I still sleep with gloves just to keep my hands from cracking open.<br /><br />I’m not even sure how I stumbled across argan oil, but I saw pretty rave reviews for it and figure, “what the heck!” I’ve only used the Pura D’or Organic Argan Oil for a few days, but I must say I’m very impressed. I would love to make the bold claim that my psoriasis is magically gone, but it’s not; however, the patches are significantly better than before and the maddening itch has TREMENDOUSLY subsided. I haven’t even felt a need to use my prescription cortisone ointments for the past several nights, and I’ve enjoyed a few good nights of rest without gloves.<br /><br />Also, I tried a little rub in my crazy, uncontrollable mop of curly hair and it is a bit less frizzy than normal. Makes my hair and newly grown beard feel soft, which is always a good thing.<br /><br />Whether you just want a good, natural, non-greasy way to soften and reduce the dryness of your skin, or if you have painful psoriasis or eczema, give this a shot. It’s a good price and I’m definitely glad I stumbled across it.

  1819. After using this for several days, I must admit that I am VERY pleased with this. It has a nutty kind of smell, and a tiny bit goes a VERY long way.<br /><br />When I was originally contacted by Pura D'or, I asked a lot of questions before I agreed to test this for review. I am not a huge fan of anything that is environmentally a problem, or that manipulates and uses people. It was only after checking this out that I agreed to try a sample and give my own honest opinion about it.<br /><br />First, I discovered that Argan Oil comes from nuts grown from the Argan tree in Morocco. The tree is endangered, but rather than diminishing the trees, the sale of the oil has promoted growth of additional trees, and Morocco has set aside preserves to protect this national treasure.<br /><br />Second, I discovered that some of the processing of this oil must be done manually. Morocco has established women's cooperatives to process the oil, who are paid directly. As a result, the processing of the oil has benefited women and the economy.<br /><br />Since I could stand behind it (if it worked), I allowed Pura d'or to send me a complimentary sample for my personal use and testing.<br /><br />Meeting my personal standards doesn't matter, if it doesn't work. After reading through the reviews, I did try it. I placed two drops on my hand, and rubbed it in, then gently placed it around my eyes, massaging it in. Unlike some creams, this oil didn't strictly disappear, rather it stayed to work its wonders. It felt moistened rather than oily.<br /><br />I have purchased expensive creams before, and after a short period of time they don't seem to be effective. In this case, even several hours later my eye area still felt soft and moist. I don't have a lot of lines, but the ones I had appeared smaller, even from the start. After several days, my eyes look younger. I have also used this on my legs for winter dry skin, and while it took more, it did effectively moisten my legs as well.<br /><br />Since Argan oil is also used as a cooking oil (food grade), I also took a brief taste of this. There was the tiniest nut taste. This isn't food grade, so I don't recommend cooking with it, but we reviewers are notoriously curious (and picky) about any products that end up in our hands, particularly if we are asked to consider them for review.<br /><br />I am continuing to explore ways to use this oil, besides the all-important eyes, and my legs, and as far as I am concerned, this is the oil that has helped my wrinkles better than any other./>Since Argan oil is also used as a cooking oil (food grade), I also took a brief taste of this. There was the tiniest nut taste. This isn't food grade, so I don't recommend cooking with it, but we reviewers are notoriously curious (and picky) about any products that end up in our hands, particularly if we are asked to consider them for review.<br /><br />I am continuing to explore ways to use this oil, besides the all-important eyes, and my legs, and as far as I am concerned, this is the oil that has helped my wrinkles better than any other.

  1821. This is an organic, cold-pressed oil from the kernel from the seed of the fruit of the argan tree. It is almost colorless, with a faint, slightly sweet and natural scent, definitely nutty but unique, with just a hint of earthy spiciness similar to nutmeg or mace. It comes in an amber glass bottle with a pump that neatly dispenses a large drop.<br /><br />This argan oil will improve the appearance of dry skin and cuticles in just a few days. It doesn't feel at all greasy or oily after massaging it into the skin but simply leaves it smooth and moist. After applying it at night, the skin is still moist in the morning rather than dry. It can also be used sparingly on the hair and scalp.<br /><br />I have tried many different brands of argan oil, and this one is very high-quality, pure and fresh, and a pleasure to use.<br /><br />Pura d'or provided argan oil for evaluation and review.

Many products CONTAIN SOME argon oil....but most are not PURE. 3) COMPARE the labels, INGREDIENTS & reviews of this to the others on the market. So when I was approached to try this, I was enthusiastic to accept. This Argan oil seems like the perfect fit.<br /><br />The bottle is somewhat small and due to the price, I'm hesitant to use it all over my body. The good part is you need very little to get the job done. One squirt gives you about a pea-sized amount and that is more than enough for hands and even forearms. There is a light, pleasant scent that is natural, and the oil works quickly.<br /><br />The instructions say you can use it in your hair, which I did, but the result wasn't what I hoped. It made my hair look greasy - as if I hadn't washed in several days - instead of shiny and smooth.<br /><br />Still, I use it everyday for my hands and love it so far.
  1912. I will be the first to admit I usually do not spend a lot of money on personal skin care and hair products. If I do need to purchase something special, such as a facial moisturizer or deep conditioner for my hair, I generally peruse my coupon stash and then try and find something competitively priced that I have a coupon for. In the absence of a coupon I will find a comparable store brand product and take my purchase home to use.<br /><br />Thus, being given the opportunity to try Pura d'Or Argan Oil is a bit of a luxury for me. I am the girl who wears no makeup; the depth of my skincare routine is applying Oil of Olay to my face and Eucerin to my dry, cracked skin only when I feel it is needed. Using a beauty product (especially one that is an oil treatment) that costs more than $10 is \\"high class\\", and after using this product for nearly 2 full weeks I can say with 100% honesty that you do get what you pay for.<br /><br />Packaging<br /><br />Pura d'Or Argan Oil (shipped to you within a bubble envelope inside of a sturdy box) is packaged within a glass bottle with a plastic dispenser tip and a cover to placed over the top when finished. In this instance I tried the 4 fl. oz. (118 mL) bottle. Due to the aforementioned careful packaging, there was no damage to the bottle. Oh, and I forgot to mention that the bottle arrives inside of a small, linen drawstring bag. Personally, having to pull the bottle out of a bag each time that I wish to use the product was a bit annoying so I repurposed the bag for some other knick-knacks.<br /><br />The bottle itself is brown glass and feels durable. The shiny gold label on the bottle clearly indicates the product name, uses, and prominently indicates that the product is USDA organic and cruelty free. The plastic dispenser will give you exactly a pea-sized droplet of the argan oil when you depress it. Since the directions for use on the side of the package indicates that you simply need a pea-sized amount, the dispenser is ingenious and also minimizes the possibility of you using too much. I found this aspect to be very nice.<br /><br />Uses<br /><br />Pura d'Or Argan Oil reminds me somewhat of WD-40. No, I do not recommend using it to grease the hinges on your doors; what I mean is there are a lot of uses for this product other than the obvious as a skin moisturizer. The label indicates that it can be used as a \\"daily moisturizer, morning & nighttime treatment, and to heal, protect & condition everything from head to toe\\". I should note that I did not use it to cover my entire body, rather, I used it for a few specific issues that I believe a lot of people experience. These issues are below:<br /><br />Split Ends: I have rather long, thick hair. The extent of my haircare is to brush it back while it is still wet and put it into a ponytail or a loose braid. I sometimes use a deep conditioner but by and large I generally just shampoo my hair. I rarely use blow dryer or put a lot of products in my hair. Hair spray is something that I only use if I am going out. This means that I do not have a lot of damage to my hair, however; I do get a fairly good amount of split ends. Using the oil, I massaged three pea-sized droplets into the end of my hair each night before I went to bed. After about a week of nightly use my split ends seem to be much healthier and I did not notice any further damage to the ends of my hair. This is a definite thumbs-up for this product.<br /><br />Severely Dry Skin: due to the winter time my skin dries out fairly often. The dry heat from the furnace will result in patches that are almost scaly and can be downright painful. Before I received this oil to try I used Eucerin Intense Repair Ointment; while the ointment helped, it seemed like I had to apply it several times a day -and the dry skin always came back. For the argan oil, I used it on a particularly rough spot on my elbow; this is one of the many spots I tried to heal with the Eucerin beforehand. I rubbed in a pea-sized amount of the oil two times a day; within three days my elbow was completely healed. In fact, I have not had a recurrence of that particular dry skin patch since it healed.<br /><br />Nail and Cuticle: again due to the dry heat associated with winter (forced air heating through a furnace), the skin around my fingernails and the cuticles themselves sometimes crack and even bleed. I used Pura d'Or Argan Oil on all 10 fingers, again with applications twice daily. While it didn't heal any wounds, I did notice that my fingernails were healthier and the skin around them had fewer cracks. In addition I was able to push my cuticles back easier. Pura d'Or Argan Oil did not exacerbate any cuts and/or scrapes near my fingernails, nor did it sting if it came into contact with them.<br /><br />Product impression<br /><br />Being organic, there are neither chemical preservatives nor additives. I will admit that I was a bit hesitant to use it at first as I was afraid there may be an unpleasant odor as there were no perfumes. Happily, I could not detect any scent at all; as a result I was comfortable using it on both my face and neck. Another bonus is that I had no reaction to the oil. I have sensitive skin and in the past have had some lotions and creams cause small rashes. Since Pura d'Or Argan Oil is organic, the lack of chemical additives reduces the likelihood of an uncomfortable skin condition.<br /><br />The oil itself is rather thin; it has the texture of corn oil (meaning it is relatively light) and a pale amber color. The big question, of course, is whether Pura d'Or Argan Oil leaves a greasy residue. I can say with confidence that it does not - if the directions are followed! The only greasiness that I felt was during the first 30 seconds after application while it was being absorbed into my skin and/or hair. After that there was no residue and I was able to open doors and perform other tasks without leaving behind any trace that I applied Pura d'Or Argan Oil.<br /><br />Finally, if you manage to dribble any Pura d'Or Argan Oil onto your clothing it could leave a grease stain. I was able to use a dry paper towel to blot out any that I did get onto my clothing and subsequently washed it with no lasting harm. I should note that most of my clothing is cotton; I cannot attest to any stains or grease spots that could be left on other fabrics. That being said I do recommend exercising caution so that you do not drip any oil onto your clothing.<br /><br />Overall<br /><br />While the price of Pura d'Or Argan Oil may intimidate some, as I mentioned earlier, you do get what you pay for. You only need a small amount to get the amazing results that I did so your investment will pay off in spades. Between moisturizing my skin, conditioning my hair, and rejuvenating my fingernails and cuticles, Pura d'Or Argan Oil is an amazing product that I wish I had tried sooner. The fact that it is also organic and not tested on animals is a definite plus.<br /><br />In short, if you would like a product that will heal your dry skin and also do other amazing things, Pura d'Or Argan Oil should be part of your beauty routine. You will find (as I did)that this oil will replace several other beauty products that you have; so while the cost may seem high at first, you will no longer need to spend money on lotion, conditioner, or other ointments. Heck, you may even save money by purchasing this product since you will no longer need to spend it on other items. I give Pura d'Or Argan Oil a hearty thumbs up!ized amount of the oil two times a day; within three days my elbow was completely healed. In fact, I have not had a recurrence of that particular dry skin patch since it healed.<br /><br />Nail and Cuticle: again due to the dry heat associated with winter (forced air heating through a furnace), the skin around my fingernails and the cuticles themselves sometimes crack and even bleed. I used Pura d'Or Argan Oil on all 10 fingers, again with applications twice daily. While it didn't heal any wounds, I did notice that my fingernails were healthier and the skin around them had fewer cracks. In addition I was able to push my cuticles back easier. Pura d'Or Argan Oil did not exacerbate any cuts and/or scrapes near my fingernails, nor did it sting if it came into contact with them.<br /><br />Product impression<br /><br />Being organic, there are neither chemical preservatives nor additives. I will admit that I was a bit hesitant to use it at first as I was afraid there may be an unpleasant odor as there were no perfumes. Happily, I could not detect any scent at all; as a result I was comfortable using it on both my face and neck. Another bonus is that I had no reaction to the oil. I have sensitive skin and in the past have had some lotions and creams cause small rashes. The big question, of course, is whether Pura d'Or Argan Oil leaves a greasy residue. I can say with confidence that it does not - if the directions are followed! The only greasiness that I felt was during the first 30 seconds after application while it was being absorbed into my skin and/or hair. After that there was no residue and I was able to open doors and perform other tasks without leaving behind any trace that I applied Pura d'Or Argan Oil.<br /><br />Finally, if you manage to dribble any Pura d'Or Argan Oil onto your clothing it could leave a grease stain. You only need a small amount to get the amazing results that I did so your investment will pay off in spades. Between moisturizing my skin, conditioning my hair, and rejuvenating my fingernails and cuticles, Pura d'Or Argan Oil is an amazing product that I wish I had tried sooner. The fact that it is also organic and not tested on animals is a definite plus.<br /><br />In short, if you would like a product that will heal your dry skin and also do other amazing things, Pura d'Or Argan Oil should be part of your beauty routine. You will find (as I did)that this oil will replace several other beauty products that you have; so while the cost may seem high at first, you will no longer need to spend money on lotion, conditioner, or other ointments. Heck, you may even save money by purchasing this product since you will no longer need to spend it on other items. I give Pura d'Or Argan Oil a hearty thumbs up!

  1935. I decided to purchase this particular brand of argan oil after doing lots of general research about the oil and reading reviews for many different brands.<br /><br />I have eczema on my hands which leaves the knuckles constantly very itchy (I tear my hands up scratching them until they become raw and often bleed). They're ashy, dry and the skin is thick and not pliable. I always tried to hide my hands because they looked awful! I also have combination but very sensitive skin on my face (oily nose, dry forehead, cheeks and chin area). My face has lots of blemishes from the sensitivity.<br /><br />The day I received the oil I applied it after washing my hands, leaving them slightly damp. I massaged one pump into both hands. My knuckles immediately looked healthier, almost normal. There is an extremely faint eucalyptus aroma in the bottle, but once it's applied and absorbed into the skin, I cannot smell it whatsoever (I'm also sensitive to fragrance so I was somewhat worried about this). After applying, my skin was not oily at all. I did try it on dry hands a little later in the day, and found it did not absorb quite as well. On damp skin, there is no oily feel whatsoever, unless you use too much oil. The surface of my face now looks plumped, like the fat cells got an injection of botox! It's hard to describe but my face looks dewy and soft and alive! My routine is to wipe it first with a wedge of lemon, leave that for about 10 minutes, wash with black soap, then apply a TAD of the argan oil. My skin doesn't look greasy and that's all the moisturizing I need if I am going to apply foundation. At nites, I use 2 tads...don't ask me why...it's psychological!! Lol! I also use it on my nails and the cuticles immediately look improved; the dryness vanishes immediately. I only use a couple of pumps right after I wash my hair, which is another great thing! Even using this on both my face and hair for the past 7 weeks I still have more than half of the bottle left, so it lasts quite a long time.   2128. For some reason, in the last couple months I'd developed dandruff! I've NEVER had dandruff in my whole life! I scrubbed my scalp when I washed & the crusty bits came off but as I dried my hair & was feeling around I noticed that those same patches were like damp & all oozy with a clear liquid!<br /><br />Desperate for a working solution, I asked another hair dresser friend & she said I more than likely had a bad case of &#34;seborrheic dermatitis&#34; on my head! She recommended this stuff called Argan oil which I have never heard of! Now I've heard of tea tree oil, emu oil, even coconut oil as far as good things to use on your skin, but never this! Well I could kiss my friends feet! This product has been a miracle worker! It's been two weeks now since applying just a couple drops on my head each night! It went away almost immediately, by the 2nd or 3rd time I washed my hair, those spots completely dried up, healed & went away! I'm just now using it sparingly to keep it from EVER coming back! When I ran out, I bought Pura d'or Argan oil, in an attempt to avoid repurchasing the pricey, salon stuff. At first, I tried using the exact same amount as the old brand, 4 pumps on wet hair. Once air dried, my hair was very oily looking. I applied some heat, rolling a curling iron throughout and that helped tone down the oiliness. I've found I only need 2-3 pumps of Pura d'or Argan on the bottom half of my strands, depending on how much heat I am using when styling. I used to use a a quarter sized amount of Bumble & Bumble Defrizz (which is a great product, just a bit pricey) mixed with an equal amount of a styling cream while wet, then add a bit more of the B&B mixed with a pomade to control the frizz layer on top once my hair was completely dry. Now I'm using about a dime size of this oil to two parts styling cream on wet hair and finding that I don't need touch ups after it dries. This is great because as curly hair people know, it has to air dry which takes forever, so it's nice knowing I can just leave the house with wet hair and it will turn out right without worrying about a round two of de-frizzing. My hair feels soft and the coarse and frizzies stay tamed, and I think it looks shinier - I'm seriously happy with this oil. I did use too much the first time (three pumps for chest-length hair) and it did weigh it down a bit, so I would suggest using a tiny amount to start.

  2473. This is one of the nicest Argan Oils I've used.<br /><br />First of all, this stuff is nearly odorless. Straight out of the bottle, it has a very subtle, faint smell that reminds me of cedar wood chips. It's slightly nutty. It doesn't smell foul or off putting though, it's very fresh, which is good for a beauty product. Any smell disappears upon application. Other oils I've used in the past were far more pungent and nutty, while this one is not. I have a feeling that the dark glass bottle helps a lot with that.<br /><br />I use this for my hair. I typically use coconut oil because it's cheaper, but it's really just too heavy to leave in the hair. (I have fine, thin hair) I can only use coconut oil as a mask that I plan to wash out. THIS argan oil however, I can leave in my hair all day. I use this like how you would use a frizz serum. It makes my hair way shinier than any serum, and of course I don't have to worry about any build up or my hair getting weighed down. Argan oil is always my favorite for hair.<br /><br />My only complaint is the dispenser. I'm glad it has one rather than an eye dropper. I can't understand why eye droppers are used for this with other brands. However, despite liking that it has a dispenser, it's not a very good one. It really spits out the oil. I accidentally squirted all over my shirt when I first used it. I can only describe it like the dispenser is too strong for such a light liquid. I'd like to see them improve on that so that I can better control how much product I'm using. That's the only reason why I rank this at 4 stars. Perfect, high quality, fresh oil. I use this for my hair, lips, cuticles, hands, feet. It soaks in completely after 5-7 minutes and leaves my skin very smooth not oily. The scent is very mild, slightly nutty. This would be excellent to put on before a long flight or to refresh dehydrated skin. For allover facial use, it might be a bit heavy /oily for acne prone, or if you have very thin or oily hair. I have combination skin that gets irritated easily and dry patches in winter, so it works for me. It doesn't cause breakouts or redness on my sensitive skin.   2591. The smell is a little off-putting. As someone else mentioned here, it's a little tea tree smelling but also a vague ... organic smell, similar to a very faint emu oil. I was using Josie Maran (like half of the other reviewers here apparently!) and I wanted a cheaper alternative. I think it's a little sketchy that they advertise &#34;USDA Organic&#34;, but only have the certificate for another organic certification. As many who do organics know, the standards for organics is practically non-existent and can mean a lot of different things. I feel like there's a lack of transparency with this brand which is why there's so many &#34;authentic or not?&#34; comments. Perhaps if they put a face behind the product, what region you get your argan nuts from, and their production process, then more people will flock to it.<br /><br />However, as far as whether it's the real thing and if it works- I would assume so? It doesn't leave my skin greasy, and I haven't broken out using it. However, whether or not if it's exceptionally beneficial over something like a raw, pure EVOO, I'm not even sure because a clean oil moisturizes whether or not it's argan oil (thus why there's mineral oil in Ponds). I don't think I have a basis for comparison of whether it's actually equivalent or better than JM; I also changed my overall skincare routine so my skin has simply been better since the new year. But the mere fact that it hasn't negated the progress I've already made with my skin says to me that this product is in the right direction.

  2647. We have been experimenting with Pura d'or Argan Oil for just one month. We were delighted with the amazing removal of flaking, dry skin, the improvement of skin appearance, and the remarkable arresting of itch. One- minute massage instruction seemed irritating and too time-consuming. We discontinued that after only one trial and simply gently rubbed it on. Unlike competing creams such as Cetaphil, Heel Rescue, and Neosporin&Pain, your Argan Oil adheres to the skin and not come off onto clothing or upholstery. On the negative side, even through its viscosity allows just a few drops to cover, say, a forearm, I found it necessary to apply the product as often as twice a day. At five dollars per ounce, therefore, its use is expensive and would seem to highly limit the market. One way to help lower cost would be to also offer the product in a container several times as large so that the nozzle cost would be spread over a much larger amount of product. Furthermore, Pura d'or makes hair much more manageable and reduces scalp itch.

  2737. I was looking for a solution for my hair and skin separately and decided to try and tackle them both with argan oil. Success!<br /><br />Skin: I have super dry skin. I can just splash my face with water and it becomes tight and dry. I research my skin care products a lot because I don't have thousands to burn on expensive creams and serums. I have been using CeraVe AM and PM, but I wasn't getting enough moisture. After smoothing one pump of argan oil into my face after cleansing my skin finally feels moisturized! I do not have super sensitive skin and I rarely break out, so I cannot speak to those face problems. My skin does feel and look dew-y though. I now use it morning and night.<br /><br />Hair: My hair is also super dry. (Yes, I drink lots of water!). I only wash my hair once every 6 days and even then it doesn't really get oily. My hair is fine, wavy/frizzy/straight, depending on the piece of hair in question. I used two pumps after a shower on my hair and it was actually CURLY, not just frizzy! I concentrated on the ends and on the crown of frizz on top of my head. I may experiment with using more oil next time to see if I can ever get a sleek look without looking oily. People with oily hair may not have as much success, but my hair is parched and this worked great. (For reference I use kiehl's shampoo and honest conditioner, which I only halfway rinse out).

I use 3-4 pumps (which is a very small dime size amount) all over my face and neck after showering in the morning and again as a face wash and moisturizer in one before bed. My skin no longer ever feels dry & itchy and my eyes don't get irritated and watery like they did from almost all other products I've used. This is a great quality oil and a great price compared to other brands of argan oil I've tried.
  2813. I was using a different argan oil that came with my HSI straightener. I liked it, though the fragrance made it seem fake. I went to order more argan oil like the one from the straightener and came across this.<br />The first thing I noticed were the great reviews and all of the doctor and organic product certifications. When I first applied it to my damp hair, there was not a fragrance! The giveaway that the oil had not been tampered with other products :) a little goes a long way, and feels great on my shoulders. When my hair dries with this stuff ( I have hick, wavy, frizzy hair) it's not greasy and there's no frizz!! I will be ordering this as a Christmas gift!
  2814. This Argan oil has a strong scent than Josie Maran's, which I do not like. However, it is a lot cheaper. If you plan to use this only on your body, I think it's fine since you save money (4 fl of Josie Maran is $96 and this is 4 fl oz for 25% of that price). However, if you are using it for your face, it has this super nutty/wood smell (it probably smells different to each person,) but both 2 bottles of Josie Maran that I have do not have this same mildly offensive smell. Would buy again for the good price and value. It also is milder in smell than two other bottles of Argan oil I have purchased on Amazon (I had to return those two because I couldn't tolerate how smokey it smelled/it reminded me of cooking oil.)

I used to use blotting sheets half way though the day and no longer half to. I had occasionally experienced breakouts even at age 48, but no longer do with Pura d'or argan oil.   2836. I am giving it a 5, but I would rate it a 4.5 because it did not eliminate my frizz. I do need to put product in because throughout the day, my curls will begin to become more frizzy without anything holding them. I bought this to use on my hair. It should be noted that currently, I am using a curling cream product that contains argan oil as well as the Pura d'or shampoo and conditioner. With just one pump, my hair is shiny. Any more than one pump, and it starts to look greasy. However, today I did not use my curling cream and I put five pumps in my hair (just to give it some extra conditioning over the weekend), and it didn't look too oily. I think it's just a combination of all the products that I use that allow me to only use one pump. Also, my hair is waist length, curly, and thick. I would recommend only applying the oil below the scalp because otherwise it looks too greasy on the top of the head.<br /><br />Also, I tried one pump on my face and it helped my acne! I bought their special acne treatment oil and it seems to be working well so far.<br /><br />I liked the results of the oil, so I bought the Pura d'or Tranquility Shampoo and Pura d'or Conditioner because of how well the oil worked.<br /><br />I love how the scent it very light and I no longer smell it once I put it in my hair. This is crucial to me because I have a very strong sense of smell, so I get migraines if anything smells too strong. Overall, I have found this to be a wonderful product that has multiple uses.   2857. After trying a number of different belly balms over the course of three pregnancies, I came across this oil. I try to avoid any chemicals in general, but especially during pregnancy. After reading that Argan oil can be used to prevent and treat stretch marks, I decided to give it a try. I chose this one because it is organic and pure Argan oil -- which gets a great rating on the Environmental Workin Group's Skin Deep website. I am 7 months into my third pregnancy I can definitely feel the difference. In the past I haven't been able to find anything that reduces the dryness and itching on my stretched belly, but this does the trick! No more itching, my belly appears very well moisturized, and the stretch marks that I had acquired during my last two pregnancies really do seem less noticeable.   2865. As a newcomer to argan oil, I was surprised by how versatile it is. You can apply it to any part of your body, from hair to heels. My skin absorbs it quickly, no matter where I put it, and because of this, it doesn't leave an oily sheen, just a silky softness. The only application that I did not like was in my hair -- more on that later.<br /><br />I have extremely delicate and sensitive skin on my face, and I had no negative reactions to the oil, even when I applied it under my eyes. (I did this only after trying it on the rest of my face for a few days.) My hands are staying hydrated between applications, even after I wash my hands a lot during the day and use alcohol-based germ killer. Often in the winter I have to use a thick cream on my hands at night, and by the next night, my hands are crying out for more. If I skip a day of argan, my hands don't seem to mind. The oil is supposed to be good for nail strengthening and cuticle softening. While it softened my cuticles, I can't say what effect, if any, it is having on my nails since they are generally strong.<br /><br />I researched argan oil online so that I would know one should look for when purchasing it. This brand fits all the criteria: glass bottle, dark container, cold-pressed oil, 100% argan. I also discovered from the research that argan oil is perishable (hence the need for a dark bottle), so if you don't use it up within six months or so, you should buy a new bottle. The Pura D'Or Argan Oil uses a pump to dispense the oil, and that can be a little messy. I also wonder how well it will work when the oil gets near the bottom. The drips down the side of the bottle from using the pump got a half-star deduction from me.<br /><br />I also did a comparison between argan oil and the much cheaper castor oil, which is often used for the same purposes. Castor oil was much stickier and more difficult to spread. It also was not absorbed as quickly, which meant that the oily sheen lasted longer. The argan oil simply feels more silky, and I felt confident that I was spreading a thin layer everywhere.<br /><br />Now about using it on hair . . . . it was not a good thing for me. I used a small amount, about as much as I would on my face, and massaged it into my wet hair before styling. Ick. Even after combing it through, I could see it and feel it in my dried hair. The argan oil did not get absorbed as quickly as it did on my skin. Because I'm blonde, the argan oil darkened the areas where it stuck. This might be great to use on dark and/or damaged hair, but it had only negative effects on mine. I won't waste this expensive oil on my head again. This didn't make me love the argan oil any less, but it did teach me where it worked best on my body.<br /><br />Argan oil has been a revelation for me. I like that a natural, organic oil can actually work better than many preserved, perfumed, chemically-created products. Note: The manufacturer supplied a sample for review.<br /><br />-- Debbie Lee Wesselmanne argan oil simply feels more silky, and I felt confident that I was spreading a thin layer everywhere.<br /><br />Now about using it on hair . . . . it was not a good thing for me. I used a small amount, about as much as I would on my face, and massaged it into my wet hair before styling. Ick. Even after combing it through, I could see it and feel it in my dried hair. The argan oil did not get absorbed as quickly as it did on my skin. Because I'm blonde, the argan oil darkened the areas where it stuck. This might be great to use on dark and/or damaged hair, but it had only negative effects on mine. I won't waste this expensive oil on my head again. This didn't make me love the argan oil any less, but it did teach me where it worked best on my body.<br /><br />Argan oil has been a revelation for me. I like that a natural, organic oil can actually work better than many preserved, perfumed, chemically-created products. Note: The manufacturer supplied a sample for review.<br /><br />-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

  2867. I was introduced to Argan oil recently and was provided with a sample of Pura D'Or Pure and Organic Argan Oil. After researching it and discovering it's various cosmetic uses, I have finally settled to using it on my scalp and hair.<br /><br />Argan comes from Morocco and this particular cold-pressed Argan oil is pure, has very little scent (if any) and provides a wonderful booster and sheen to hair ... and nourishment to the scalp (especially if it is dry). I have used this oil on my skin (and I use Virgin Coconut oil as well) and my scalp and hair. It is oil, so it has the feel of oil without a lot of the heaviness. Massaged into the roots, it provides vitality and sheen.<br /><br />As I experiment with this product further, I will discover more uses I am sure.   2869. Amazing product! I've been using it for years and it really keeps your skin moisturized and healthy without being oily.
  2870. I was raised to always take care of my skin; but as I've gotten older, I've become a bit more zealous in keeping it hydrated and healthy. At the same time, I'm also more conscientious now about using more natural products. I'll admit to being a bit skeptical at first when I began hearing all the talk of argan oil. Certainly as a younger woman, I'd avoided putting any \\"oil\\" on my face for fear of breakouts; but even at my age now, old habits die hard, and I was a bit reluctant to start. Finally decided to try it, though. At first, I just pumped several drops to try out on neck and the backs of my hands after drying off after a shower. Then I started putting it on areas of my face that have never broken out (do I sound like a scaredy-cat, or what?). All still good. This argan oil glides on silkily, not slippery or greasy like some oils. When I first apply the oil, there is a definite oil sheen to my skin. Worried me the first time...but it just absorbs in a couple of minutes and I'm left with soft, protected skin. My biggest surprise was that it seems to maybe have a bit of a healing property to it. I have normal skin that can get a bit dry during the indoor-heat of winter; but, while I am definitely well past the age of regular skin breakouts, every few months or so, I end up with a small blemish on my nose or chin (the only areas of my face that ever tend to be oily). I was really leery of putting the argan oil on these areas. I mean, really, just asking for trouble, right? But, after reading a couple of reviewers say that it cleared up blemishes for them, I tried it on a small blemish that had popped up on the side of my nose. I had been dabbing a Q-tip with an alcohol-based drier on the blemish to make it go away which had the nasty side-effect of making the skin around the blemish dry and flaky. Nothing like calling extra attention to the bump on your nose. Oddly enough, after I finally \\"braved\\" putting the oil on the blemish, the redness went away and the spot was gone in a day or two. Weird...not sure what that's all about.<br /><br />I think my favorite way of using argan oil is in my hair. The amount you use should probably be adjusted depending on whether or not you have dry or normal hair and the length of your hair. My hair is normal and about chin length. I rub a couple drops of the oil between my palms and then work it through my hair when it is nearly dry and then finish drying and styling. Just my way of doing it...you can also add to still wet hair. In my hair, it adds shine and conditioning without leaving my hair looking oily. It also does a good job of separating the waves and curls in my hair. The smell of the oil is pleasant...very mild with a faint scent that reminds me of something herbal. After checking into what the \\"scent\\" is, I found that it is just the faint residual smell from the tea tree oil that they use to disinfect their equipment. Still smells nice, though.<br /><br />Although I like the product and am finding a number of uses for it, I'm finding that the argan oil is still not a sufficient replacement for the more emollient-rich night creams that I've been using. With my older skin, it just feels like they remain on my skin longer. Instead I put on a small amount of the Pura D'or argan oil before heading outside for my morning exercise (also good for chapped lips). I see that Pura D'or also has an organic Anti-Aging Face Cream available on Amazon (with strong reviews). This cream may have the more emollient, moisturizing feel that I'm looking for. At $89, I'll probably need to wait until I see it available for a lower price before I try it out, though.<br /><br />A sample bottle of Pura D'or argan oil was provided to me for reviewing purposes.as gone in a day or two. Weird...not sure what that's all about.<br /><br />I think my favorite way of using argan oil is in my hair. The amount you use should probably be adjusted depending on whether or not you have dry or normal hair and the length of your hair. My hair is normal and about chin length. I rub a couple drops of the oil between my palms and then work it through my hair when it is nearly dry and then finish drying and styling.   2874. This is not Argan oil. One pump leaves my thick hair greasy and smelly. Argan oil should have a lovely, nutty smell. This smells faintly of diarrhea. I'm not being hyperbolic either. It literally has a faint smell of diarrhea.
  2875. Nothing comes close in comparison to this amazing product for relieving dry problem skin conditions. Nothing! I am 57, have advanced Palmoplantar Keraterderma (since 2010), which in layman's terms is a serious hardening of the skin on the soles of the feet and the palms of the hands. I live in AZ, an incredibly dry state which adds to this problem of cracked soles and palms that break open and bleed and peal constantly. My dermatologist has tried everything to cure my condition, which is of course stress related. I've been on $500 prescriptions for Clobex, Calcitratin, Hydrocortizones, etc. and nothing managed to keep my skin moist, pliable, or allow it to heal. I've used petroleum jelly and saran wrap to alleviate the condition, but inevitably the skin dries every time after showering and once the shoes are off. I've used Aveeno Eczema Therapy cream, Cetaphil Restoraderm (for months), and other over the counter remedies recommended by my dermatologist. They all failed to maintain consistent moisture within the layer of derm beneath the surface skin, and the minute I had to bathe or wash my hands I was back to square one. Ladies and gentlemen, I'm here to tell you this is the answer. This is the one! The miracle cure. I've used Pura D'or now for three days with four small applications to my hands and feet. I've also bathed, washed my hair, done some housecleaning without gloves, etc, and guess what? My hands remained soft and pliant. No kidding! I was amazed. And my feet...well, the minute I applied the oil the thickening of the soles began to soften and literally peel off! I've never had such ease in removing these stubborn and normally painful calluses that crack and bleed. Well, the bleeding is gone, the calluses have disappeared, the soles are soft and pliable. I don't have to wear socks 24/7 and can now wear my sandals. I've washed my hands numerous times and they continue to remain soft and pliable--even when using soap! Even more wonderful is how this oil does not leave an oily residue on your hands or feet. It soaks in and leaves a silky smooth surface. I was so excited I applied the same oil to my face and neck area which is now silky smooth. Then I went over the back of my hands which also eliminated the dry scaling and tiny scabs I acquired working with horses and gardening. They are now all gone and I have the skin of a baby's behind instead. I can't express enough how happy I am with this product! When you've endured a serious skin condition for years and nothing has worked, then you come across something as amazing as this which is also organic, full of antioxidants, Vitamin A and E, Omega 3s and 6s, Carotene, Phenolic Acid and Amino Acids--all the healthy things in life, it is like being reborn. I used this oil on my husband's arthritic feet for a good long rub and he said he slept like a baby and the callous on the ball of his foot is magically gone. This is the only item you will ever need in your medicine cabinet for fast dry skin relief...ever! The price is a pittance for this kind of blessed relief and I highly recommend it for anyone with problematic skin conditions.   2886. I have tried so many different Argan oils since it became popular and some made me wonder what the heck was really in the bottle, they didn't work well or were to greasy or smelled funny. I was skeptical to try yet another claim of Argan oil but this one said it was pure and organic so I gave it a try.<br />I live in the North where it is cold and we use a wood stove, and my skin and hair gets VERY dry and I sometimes have flaky and itchy skin. I have tried every lotion out there for this condition and nothing worked, the only thing that comes close to moisturizing my dry skin in the winter is oil after a shower.<br />I tried this Pura D'or pure argan oil this morning. I put a bunch into my clean dry hair and then covered it in a warm towel for about 30 minutes. I made sure to mostly get the ends and massage it into my scalp and then combed it through with a wide tooth comb. Then I took off the towel and jumped in the shower, I washed my hair with shampoo once, and then put more oil on the ends of my hair and at the nape of my neck where it gets really dry, and then I put my regular conditioner on the ends and left that on for about 6 minutes. I rinsed and when I dried my hair it was soft, and no tangles, I lost much less hair down the drain as well.<br />I also used the oil on my body when I got out of the shower, I would use 3 pumps of oil in one hand and a pump of my moisturizing lotion and mix it together and put it on. If you have dry skin you MUST try this. My skin is not dry at all, is not tight or itchy and is very soft to the touch. I would highly recommend this Argan oil over all others that I have tried.<br />I am going to add a few drops of this oil to my conditioner bottle and my body and hand lotion bottles, this way each time I wash my hands or put on lotion I will be getting some of the benefits of this oil. I am extremely happy with this product.

However, it does smell...funky. Like sour rubber...I don't even know how to describe it. I definitely don't want to be walking around smelling this all day on my face. I mixed it with some Rosehip seed oil and jojoba oil last night before bed and the smell wasn't overpowering, but I'm not super impressed. We want our beauty products to smell nice...not rank. If this is the natural smell of the oil, then maybe it's just not the one for me.

Pura d'or has such a light scent in the bottle that I couldn't even smell once it was on my face. The first night I put it in my hair and all over my face, neck and chest. My skin is very dry and getting more so as I age. The next morning I washed my hair and face in the shower and when I looked in the mirror later I couldn't believe how soft and shiny my hair was!   2891. I got this as a gift, of course paid for by my husband. I used it for a few days, not knowing what to expect. One reviewer said it works great for their face and the bottle does say for the skin as well so I tried it. After a good face wash I dabbed on a layer of this oil. At first it felt oily but light. After a few minutes of picking up after myself I noticed I no longer felt the oil. My T-zone felt normal, not clogged. So, I tried this same routine for a few days (I've been using it only once at night after a shower.) I'm usually not too impressed by gimmicks and new products but I do like this oil. The results?! My blackheads on my T-zone are subsiding or haven't built up, that's a good sign. The redness around my nose, on my chin and cheeks are subtlely lighter, as though I've dabbed on a layer of BB cream, which I haven't yet. The dryness on my temples and the tip of my chin feels normal, not dry to peeling. I've also tried the oil along with my normal combination of coconut oil and Aveeno lotion for my belly area where I had an incision from a C-sec. Honestly it doesn't itch and feels extra moist than normal. My skin feels smooth. I am going to use it longer and try other areas, with or without coconut oil. I'll update as soon as I see better results. But so far this oil is nonclogging, not oily after applied. The scent is subtle yet nice, almost spa-ish like, almost like a natural smell which I have no previous argan oil to compare to. The pump is ok, because sometimes I just want a smaller application like a dot, but the pump does squirt out enough for the whole face. The fact that it's also USDA Organic, Cruelty Free, etc. it's very self reassuring the oil is supported from reliable resources. I am of Asian origin with light to medium combination skin.
