It finally happened to me where I spilled my Retinol bottle but that means one oops in one year’s time…..not too bad. The Argan oil is unrefined and you get 100% pure cold-pressed oil. Fine and light in texture and my eyes love this stuff. I get zero issues when it comes to eye make-up application the following day. Primers are great for staying and longevity power with eye shadows and the like, but can be drying and stressful to the skin on your eye’s lid and surrounding parts. So little can be applied to this sensitive area but I have found that Argan is kind enough to never irritate, leaves zero residue the following morning that may cause make-up to crease, and offers a perfect barrier of protection. It’s one of the few oils I have witnessed that actually dissipates and fully absorbs into the skin in that area. Vitamin E oil floats and I think I do more damage trying to remove it and Coconut oil loves my lashes but because of it’s temperament towards temperatures, its want to solidify can cause some areas to be almost mealy and again heavier than desired in residue. So, in short, Argan on the eye lids and pat around nicely (plus softly) and Coconut oil on the lashes! Simple ingredients with a multitude of uses and Argan oil beats any nail/cuticle oil on the market. Nothing beats a real nude look like toe nails that are healthy and beautiful for Spring and Summer shoes! I received the above product(s) free of charge from Pur D’ or. It's been about a week since I made the switch and my face is well on its way to a clear complexion once more. That said, I ordered Pura d'or around three weeks ago because I was on the hunt for a product that would help clear my breakouts and the scars they left behind. It's proven a reliable facial moisturizer and it's helped produce a healthy glow on my face.   2990. To my nose, the oil smells a bit like the way an olive tastes — earthy, almost like manure. I love olives, so it doesn't bother me, but my bf is less enthused about it. However, the scent seems to dissipate quickly.<br /><br />Since getting the bottle, I've been using it for various skin-related issues:<br /><br />1. Facial moisturizer: I really like the way the skin on my face feels after moisturizing with a little bit of this oil. At first, I would pump 1-2 drops into my palms then rub it into my face. That actually made me break out ): After some trial and error, the method that works for me is to pump a couple drops in my palms, rub it over my hands like hand lotion, then use the tiny residual amount leftover on my palms to gently pat my face. Deposits just enough oil to moisturize my face without saturating it in too much oil and making me break out.<br /><br />2. Hair moisturizer: 2-3 drops on my palms, rub around like hand lotion, then run my hands through my hair. It controls flyaways and makes my hair feel silky. I like combing some through my hair before I sleep. I've noticed my hair is healthier and more hydrated since using this regularly.<br /><br />3. Beard balm: I like to think it makes my bf's beard less scratchy, but the effect isn't major. He does like how it feels on his beard though.<br /><br />4. My FAVORITE use for this oil, and the #1 reason why I'd buy this again — body moisturizer. At night, my skin gets really itchy for no discernible reason. My legs, arms, and back get these itchy hives-like spots. Rubbing this oil onto the itchy spots stops all irritation within seconds, and I no longer have to scratch myself. It's amazing. I don't know how or why, all I know is that it works to calm down my night hives. I've also noticed that my scattering of chest acne — recurring breakouts and scarring on my chest kept me from wearing low-neck shirts for the past two months — calmed down and faded away within a week of regular oil application.<br /><br />So in summary, this oil performed much better than I expected, and because 1-2 drops go such a long way, I think it's well worth the price tag./>So in summary, this oil performed much better than I expected, and because 1-2 drops go such a long way, I think it's well worth the price tag.

  3124. In a word: &#34;love!&#34;.<br /><br />I love this product. I have long hair that has a mind of its own. On humid days it's frizzy and even knotted out of control. It seems that dimethacone (sp?) is the common hair smoothing ingredient. It's also drying and once your hair looks good there's this sort of backlash where your hair goes to crap, dry and damaged. For the record I have a very simple hair regimen. I wash, condition and dry it. My hair is long, thick and so I'm told pretty. After more research it seems that a pure oil approach would be the best. It could be controlled better and there would be no damage to my hair. I came across this product on Amazon and absolutely love it! After showering and combing out my hair I add about 3-4 pumps of Argan Oil (my hair is very long!) and rub it into the length of my hair (never the scalp). Then comb for about 30 more seconds and voila! My hair is softer, smoother and shinier than every before with no more time than I would normally spend on my hair. The comb now never a struggles to get through my hair and even a simple long ponytail is lovely. My hair still has nice, soft natural waves without any frizz. I really love this product! Aside from shampoo and conditioner this is the only thing I put in my hair. For so little effort it makes a radical difference in how my hair looks and even more importantly in how it feels so smooth and soft now. This Argan Oil by Pura d' Or really is a fabulous product, and it has a fantastic, light nutty scent from the Argan nut! Highly recommended!
  3125. This product is amazing! I have very dry skin and immediately upon using it, noticed a difference in fine lines and wrinkled. My skin feel much softer! I was drawn to this product because it is organic. I appreciate the pump that comes with the bottle and the value is unmatched!

  3145. I purchased this product from a 50% retail Groupon deal. I liked the claim that it was organic and for the price and volume, it seemed like a really good deal, and I was very excited when it arrived. However, upon the first use, I immediately became somewhat doubtful as to whether this product is 1) organic and 2) even 100% argan oil. Reason being is because as soon as I pumped a couple of small drops into my palm upon my first use, I was immediately hit with a faint but very \\"there\\" medicinal smell. Kinda like Noxema. That alone makes me a bit skeptical about this company's claim that this product is 100% organic and 100% argan oil. Even in its raw state, before it's cold-pressed to remove it's natural scent, argan oil is said to have a nutty smell. I can't imagine why 100% argan oil would have a medicinal smell. All that being said, I haven't experienced any adverse side effects, but I can say that it doesn't make my skin as soft as my old stand-by, Eden Allure argan oil. On the plus side, it did absorb into my skin quickly, which is to be expected of argan oil. But unless I am offered a logical reason as to why this product smells the way it does, I will probably not use, much less buy, it again. I don't think it's a bad product, but I am a somewhat doubtful as to whether the product is what the company claims it is.<br /><br />UPDATE: I've changed my review from 3 stars to 5 stars. In response to the seller's reply to my comment, I went to a local store and took a whiff of tea tree oil and I can confirm that this is indeed the medicinal smell that emanates from my bottle of argan oil. So, I decided to give this brand of argan oil another try and I have to admit that my skin has never looked better. I haven't had a single breakout since I've been using it and even the lines under my eyes have significantly diminished which is something that no eye cream has ever been able to do. I would actually give this 4.5 stars if I could since it still doesn't make my skin feel as soft or supple as Eden Allure argan oil and I really miss that. But even though my skin doesn't necessarily feel incredible it still looks incredible, so you won't hear too many complaints from me. I will definitely buy this brand again, but that probably won't be for a long while since this 4 oz bottle will likely last several more months, which is great.make my skin feel as soft or supple as Eden Allure argan oil and I really miss that. But even though my skin doesn't necessarily feel incredible it still looks incredible, so you won't hear too many complaints from me.   3177. tl;dr - If you're looking for genuine Moroccan argan oil, this is not it. Pay the pretty penny that it's actually worth and get it from a reputable dealer.<br /><br />There's just no way this is genuine 100% argan oil: the smell is off, the look is off, the feel is off. If it seems too good to be true...it probably is. There's a reason it's so cheap, y'all. My cocnut oil feels lighter weight and absorbs more quickly into my skin than this stuff, which is ridiculous since coconut oil takes forever to absorb and usually leaves me feeling a bit greasy relative other oils.<br /><br />I can only guess that all the other positive reviews came from folks who a) had never moisturized with any kind of oil before, so are shocked by the great results even if they're just slathering vegetable oil all over their faces (by the smell and feel of it, this stuff is undoubtedly diluted with some other kind of oil and/or water) and can't stop raving about it b) are being paid to write scam reviews or c) are crazy. Maybe all of the above.<br /><br />I had only wanted to try argan oil because of all the hype, but in the end I just can't see how one oil could be so much more superior to another that has so many of the same properties. This bottle of scam oil is going back and I'm sticking with coconut. It gives me a beautiful, smooth complexion and carries many of the same properties as argan oil without the labor intensive extraction process and therefore at a fraction is the price. If it ain't broke, don't fix it.

  3211. I'm confused with all the hype around this product. Works fine for hair, but a greasy alternative to lotion.<br />HAIR: I've been using it for about a month now on my hair. It works fine. It takes a bit to get used to figuring how much to use. To much, and your're back in the shower, there's no fixing it. I use 2 pumps on my (fine, blonde, shoulder length) hair when it's damp, then another 1/2 pump mixed with water after it's dry. As other reviewers have mentioned, you do not need a lot. Great, right. Try getting a nickle-sized squirt of oil evenly through your hair. I mix mine with water for more even distribution. It keeps the frizzies down, and I like that it's natural.<br />LOTION / MOISTURIZER: After reading all the 5 star reviews I was sooo excited to try this as a moisturizer. I was already breaking up with my makeup consultant in my head, thinking this was going to replace my current moisturizer. I put 1 squirt on my face- didn't even cover half my face I used a second squirt, and added some water to even it out. It felt like baby oil on my face. Same thing on my body. I put it on my legs, but it didn't soak in.
  3212. Disclaimer: Pura D'or sent me a bottle for review purposes.<br /><br />I've heard a lot about argan oil as a multipurpose cosmetic treatment, but I felt like I could quite figure out how to get the most out of this product.<br /><br />For hair:<br />I tried putting it in dry hair - but it made my hair look oily. I tried putting it in damp hair, same effect. I tried using less... and I got oily patches (couldn't distribute it evenly).<br />I tried putting it in my hair at night and washing it out in the morning; I don't think this had any effect. Maybe it would make my hair stronger with repeated use though.<br /><br />For skin:<br />I tried it on my face, but my skin was feeling oily already at the time and I had some zits, so putting even more oil on it didn't feel very good.<br />I tried it on dry skin patches (like the rough skin on my elbows)... and this was pretty great. Softened the dry skin right up.<br />Seemed good as well as a general skin moisturizer (instead of body lotion).<br /><br />So I'm not sold. It seems okay but not really better than my normal hair/skin products.<br /><br />However, if you already like using argan oil, this brand seems good quality and the bottle is a big so a good value for the price.
